intro: Matthiola stelligera, commonly known as the coastal stock, is a flowering plant native to coastal regions of southern California and Baja California. It is a member of the Brassicaceae family, which includes many other flowering plants with characteristic four-petaled flowers. The plant typically grows in sandy or rocky soils along the coast, where it is adapted to salt spray and strong winds. Its flowers are usually pink or white, and it blooms from spring to early summer. Matthiola stelligera is often found in disturbed coastal habitats and is considered a rare and endangered species in some areas.
